IMesh.h

Defines interface for mesh.

IMaterialAttrib

Used for manipulating the materials assigned to a mesh.

Functions
GetAmbientColor
virtual Vector3 GetAmbientColor() = 0

Returns the ambient color for the material

GetDiffuseColor
virtual Vector3 GetDiffuseColor() = 0

Returns the diffuse color for the material

GetSpecularColor
virtual Vector3 GetSpecularColor() = 0

Returns the specular color for the material

GetSpecularExp
virtual float GetSpecularExp() = 0

Returns the specular color's exponent

GetAlpha
virtual float GetAlpha() = 0

Returns the alpha value for the material. 0.0 = transparent; 1.0 = opaque

GetMaterialID
virtual uint32 GetMaterialID() = 0

Returns a unique Id associated with this material

CGeomVertex

Defines a vertex in our mesh.

Defines a vertex on our mesh. We have two types of vertex data: 1) data that is specific to a vertex relative to a given face 2) data that is relative to a vertex regardless of face The reason for this split is so that positional information can be shared across the mesh (useful for performing operations on the geometry) while data that can change from face to face is stored separately (such as normal information).  Typically most mesh data is stored in CGeomVertex. Only faces at material boundaries or smoothing groups contain CFaceVertex data.

CFaceVertex

Defines a vertex data relative to a given face.  See CGeomVertex for further information.

CHalfEdge
CHalfEdge

Defines a single half edge on our graph

Members
m_pNext

Next half edge in edge loop

m_pPrev

Previous half edge in edge loop

m_pOpposite

Opposite half edge

m_pVertex

Vertex at head of edge

m_pFace

Face to the left of edge

m_smoothingGroup

Smoothing group this edge belongs to index -

Functions
GetNextEdge
CHalfEdge *GetNextEdge()

Returns the next edge in our edge loop

GetPrevEdge
CHalfEdge *GetPrevEdge()

Returns the previous edge in our edge loop

GetOppositeEdge
CHalfEdge *GetOppositeEdge()

Returns the half edge opposite to the current edge

GetHeadVertex
CGeomVertex *GetHeadVertex()

Returns the vertex at the head of this edge

GetTailVertex
CGeomVertex *GetTailVertex()

Returns the vertex at the tail of this edge

GetFace
CFace *GetFace()

Returns the face this edge is a boundary of

Returns

Pointer to the current face

Returns the smoothing group this edge belongs to

ID of the smoothing group this edge belongs to

CFace
CFace

Defines a face in our CMesh

Types
EVertexFlags

Define flags describing what fields are available in a SVertex

ETriangulateMethod

Defines the method used for converting a polygonal mesh into a trianglar mesh.

EMeshFlags
enum
EMeshFlags

Defines various flags associated with an ISubMesh

TwoSided

Mesh is considered to be two sided

ISubMesh

ISubMesh is used by clients for manipulating a submesh. A submesh contains actual mesh data. This is different from a mesh object which is just a collection of submesh objects.

Functions
Normalize
virtual void Normalize(
const BBox3 &bbox
) = 0

Rescales a mesh so fits inside a -0.5..+0.5 bounding box

Parameters
bbox
const BBox3&

Bounding box of the mesh

IMesh

IMesh is simply a collection of submesh objects (ISubMesh).

NOTE: This mesh is different from a renderable mesh. There is a function MeshToD3D which will convert the mesh into a renderable mesh.
